p: Each outbreak generally lasts for ~3–4 weeks; however, it might be longer on large breeding farms with multiple, isolated units and variable levels of lactogenic immunity in gilts/sows. PEDV-exposed pregnant sows can provide sufficient lactogenic immunity to protect their piglets, and PED outbreaks stop. After the passage of acute outbreak, diarrhoea may persist and is recurrent in weaned pigs, resembling endemic TGE form (Martelli et al. 2008).
